subject: Mental Health
title: Medication for Anxiety
description: A micro-lesson that makes Medication for Anxiety usable.

hook.text: SSRIs are the most prescribed drugs for anxiety, but they weren't made for it.

buildup.text: They were antidepressants that accidentally proved effective for anxiety too.

discovery.text: SSRIs boost serotonin, which helps regulate the brain's threat response.

twist.text: They take four to six weeks to work, and many patients quit before then.

climax.text: Benzodiazepines work faster but carry serious risks of dependence.

punchline.text: The right pill helps, but patience is part of it.

quiz.question: How long do SSRIs typically take to become effective?
